intro: Anisolobus hebecarpus var. erectus, commonly known as the upright thimbleweed, is a perennial herb native to North America. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features slender, upright stems that are often hairy. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters at the top of the stems, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and have a slightly rough texture. The fruit is a dry, three-lobed capsule that splits open to release seeds.
